PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: TYLER SIMMS & ST SAUVEUR CPAS PLLC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: AT DUBLIN SCHOOL WE STRIVE TO AWAKEN A CURIOSITY FOR KNOWLEDGE AND A PASSION FOR LEARNING. WE INSTILL THE VALUES OF DISCIPLINE AND COMMUNITY. WE RESPECT THE INDIVIDUAL LEARNING STYLE AND THE POTENTIAL EACH STUDENT BRINGS TO OUR SCHOOL. WITH OUR GUIDANCE, DUBLIN STUDENTS BECOME PEOPLE WHO SEEK TRUTH AND ACT WITH COURAGE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: AT DUBLIN SCHOOL WE STRIVE TO AWAKEN A CURIOSITY FOR KNOWLEDGE AND A PASSION FOR LEARNING. WE INSTILL THE VALUES OF DISCIPLINE AND COMMUNITY. WE RESPECT THE INDIVIDUAL LEARNING STYLE AND THE POTENTIAL EACH STUDENT BRINGS TO OUR SCHOOL. WITH OUR GUIDANCE, DUBLIN STUDENTS BECOME PEOPLE WHO SEEK TRUTH AND ACT WITH COURAGE.
IRS990.Desc: DUBLIN SCHOOL, INC. IS A GRADE 9-12 BOARD AND DAY SCHOOL DEDICATED TO THE EDUCATION OF ADOLESCENTS, WITH AN ACADEMICALLY RIGOROUS COLLEGE PREPARATORY PROGRAM, A STRONG COMMITMENT TO THE ARTS, A LOVE OF THE NATURAL WORLD, AND COMPETITIVE ATHLETICS. WE EDUCATE STUDENTS FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD AND SUPPORT STUDENTS ACADEMICALLY, SOCIALLY AND FINANCIALLY DEPENDING UPON THEIR UNIQUE NEEDS. DUBLIN STUDENTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO DISCOVER THEIR OWN DISTINCTIVE VOICE: WHETHER IN WRITING; ON THE STAGE; IN THE STUDIO; OR ON THE ATHLETIC FIELDS. ALL THIS IN A STUNNING LOCATION IN SOUTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: CURRENT PORTION OF OPERATING LEASE OBLIGATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PURPOSE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO MAINTAIN A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING FOR THE PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS.

ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION SUBTOPIC 740-10, ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES, ADDRESSES THE ACCOUNTING UNCERTAINTY OF INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTERPRISE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PRESCRIBES A THRESHOLD OF "MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT" FOR RECOGNITION AND DERECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. SUBTOPIC 740-10 ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON MEASUREMENT CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST, PENALTIES, AND DISCLOSURE. THE SCHOOL HAS DETERMINED THAT THE PROVISIONS OF SUBTOPIC 740-10 DO NOT HAVE A MATERIAL EFFECT ON THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE SCHOOL BELIEVES IT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO 2019.
POLICY IS STATED THROUGH ADVERTISING IN JOB POSTINGS, VARIOUS LOCATIONS ON OUR WEBSITE, AND THROUGHOUT OUR ADMISSIONS MATERIALS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: FINANCIAL AID IS GIVEN TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED AN ON SCHOLASTIC ABILITY. THE SCHOOL PROVIDES TUITION FOR CHILDREN OF FULL-TIME EMPLOYEES AS A BENEFIT (TUITION REMISSION). NAMES AND ADDRESSES OF RECIPIENTS ARE AVAILABLE IN THE SCHOOL'S BUSINESS OFFICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NAMES AND ADDRESSES OF THE FINANCIAL AID AND TUITION REMISSION RECIPIENTS ARE MAINTAINED AT THE SCHOOL. THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID AND TUITION REMISSION AWARDED IS CREDITED TO EACH RECIPIENT'S ACCOUNT AND THE NET AMOUNT DUE THE SCHOOL IS THEN BILLED TO THE STUDENT.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: CONSTRUCTION OF BUILDINGS ON SCHOOL PROPERTY

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONTROLLER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DRAFTING THE FORM 990, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE SCHOOL'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS. THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS THEN PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IN ADVANCE OF THE FILING DEADLINE TO PROVIDE TIME FOR A CONSCIENTIOUS REVIEW BY ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMITTEE. AFTER THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEW IS COMPLETE, THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD THROUGH THE SCHOOL'S SECURE PORTION OF THE WEBSITE, ALLOWING TIME FOR QUESTIONS AND CONCERNS TO BE RAISED, AND REVISIONS MADE SO THAT THE CONTROLLER, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE SCHOOL'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS CAN FILE THE FORM 990 TO THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE DISSEMINATED TO THE BOARD AT ITS ANNUAL MEETING HELD IN JUNE OF EACH YEAR. THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL'S ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT MONITORS THE RETURN OF THE STATEMENTS AND SENDS REMINDERS TO BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN EVALUATION IS CONDUCTED BY AN ADHOC COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. THE EVALUATION IS THEN GIVEN TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW AND ACTION. THE SALARY SURVEY FROM THE INDEPENDENT SCHOOL ASSOCIATION OF NORTHERN NEW ENGLAND IS USED IN THE PROCESS AS A METHOD TO ASSIST IN DETERMINING THE TOTAL COMPENSATION OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. ALL SUCH REQUESTS SHOULD BE DIRECTED TO THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL.
